H0.text: Plovers or dotterels are a type of birds classed as a. Shorebirds

H1.text: Plovers or dotterels are a type of birds classed as a. Waterfowl

H2.text: Plovers or dotterels are a type of birds classed as a. Songbirds

H3.text: Plovers or dotterels are a type of birds classed as a. Waders

A5.text: Waders or shorebirds are birds of the order Charadriiformes commonly found wading along shorelines and mudflats in order to forage for food crawling or burrowing in the mud and sand

A6.text: They hunt by sight, rather than by feel as longer-billed waders like snipe do.

A7.text: They are distributed through open country worldwide, mostly in habitats near water.

A8.text: The waders (or 'Charadrii'): typical shorebirds, most of which feed by probing in the mud or picking items off the surface in both coastal and freshwater environments.
